page.title: 17Technology in Woodmancote.
page.content: There is only one major company in this area using and selling computers, CAM systems.CAM stands for Computer Aided Marketing.CAM systems sell a wide range of computers including Apple,IBM,Apricot,Zues and Cygnet.All of these are supported by a large range of Hard/Software,printers as well as disc-drives and monitors.CAM employ only 6 full-time staff,though more are brought in when needed.The company is trying to expand by gaining contracts abroad,in particular the USA.Most of their computers are sold to the motor trade for robot control and book-keeping.No small businesses in this area,eg.Post Office,newsagent, DIY shops,use computers.A survey in Nibley indicated that computers are still something of a mystery for many adults and are thought of as games for children.
